thread.title: Scroll.in stories you may have missed this week
thread.title_full: Scroll.in stories you may have missed this week

author: Scroll Staff
title: Scroll.in stories you may have missed this week
text: The week that was Scroll.in stories you may have missed this week How our education infrastructure is being systematically demolished; Why the Times of India wants you to take your domestic worker to the see Talvar, and more. A look back at the past six days. 'Law won't protect sinners like you': Scroll.in reporter covering beef protest held for seven hours Police at Delhi's Parliament Street station refused to believe that the journalist's press card was genuine, denied him the right to make phone calls to his family or a lawyer. Find out more here . How our education infrastructure is being systematically demolished The attempt is to make everyone conform to one body of information, that, inevitably, will be dictated by those who are without specialised knowledge – politicians and bureaucrats. Find out more here . RSS leader Tarun Vijay's response to Dadri murder marks the death of the moral Indian The Hindutva ideologue's article in the Indian Express redefines the idea of innocence and guilt. Find out more here . How Narendra Modi helped spread anti-beef hysteria The Bharatiya Janata Party’s communalism around the Dadri beef lynching is directly buttressed by the prime minister's politics. Find out more here . 'Talvar': Why the Times of India wants you to take your domestic worker to the movies The paper's entertainment supplement on Sunday carried a patronising and offensive article aimed at promoting a film backed by the group's production arm. Find out more here . The unmaking of India: Why writer Nayantara Sahgal is returning her Sahitya Akademi Award Her action is a mark of respect to Indians who have been murdered defending the right to dissent, the literateur said. Find out more here . We welcome your comments at letters@scroll.in
